reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars FAST MOVING STORY
reviews.reviewText: Good read ! The whole thing flowed quite well. Got a bit long for my taste at 550 pgs and there were a couple of " oh c'mon now" moments that stretched the imagination a little bit. Lots of goodies and baddies that you could cheer or curse. Have book #2 all teed up

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good and bad
reviews.reviewText: The best part of this book was that it was very anti Russian and correctly so. They are a totally depraved country. The focus is on Russia's attempt to build a new secret, biological warfare complex . Plot details follow:: the Russians have spies everywhere, even in the US including the CIA. The Russian lab makes a deadly new biological weapon but a deadly leak occurs so the Russians try to kill many of their scientists and lab workers as they can or need to, to cover it up. CIA agents infiltrate and rescue anti Russian scientists, Many of the CIA achievements ridiculous. one young, heroic CIA agent was captured and repeatedly and horribly tortured. Any normal person would have died but this did not really slow her down at all. Her exploits make James Bond look like a hopeless amateur. Later she and her male partner, another Bond-type, easily invade the Kremlin and escape in a helicopter, despite being shot at by thousands of of rounds of ammunition and severely wounded. The CIA double agent is killed as are the Russian spies in the US--and so on. If you can put up with with extreme fiction this is an exciting read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Traitors and surprises everywhere
reviews.reviewText: Every chapter seems like a running commentary on world events, terrorist threats, morality, good guys and bad girls. What exactly separates defenders from invaders/predators....national borders? job description? profession? skill? control? power? higher good for the planet? I bought book 2.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Spy Novel
reviews.reviewText: This is a thriller novel that is hard to put down. The author keeps your attention throughout the story. The twists in the plot enhance the reader experience. I am looking forward to reading the continue story in the next novel. Due to that which seems plausible and true the story made me pause and reflect on what a Cold war truly means and the treat of bioweapons from any country. Add to that what is going on with cyber threats and A.I., praying for peaceful and trusted agreements seems almost futile. However, I still trust and pray a solution will be found.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good read. It kept me interested throughout. I guess the best recommendation is that I am going to move on to the second book in the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A Pretty Good Story in the Thriller Genre
reviews.reviewText: 'The Asset' by Saul Herzog is a rather good story with a lot of action. This is the first book that I have ever read from this author, but I will probably read more.It features Lance Spector as a CIA asset who is working to stop the Russians from deploying a biological super weapon. I had a bit of trouble getting into the story in the first several chapters and had to go back and start over after being away from it for a few days, as the other characters didn't stick with me as well as leading characters normally doThis is the first book in this series. I don't consider it as top tier as say Brad Thor or Jack Carr, but it is still better than a lot of novels out there.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars first Time Reader and now I am hooked
reviews.reviewText: This is my first Saul Herzog book and. I am so impressed with how well he draws the. Readier into the story. Once I started it was difficult to put down. I wake up and wonder what is going to happen next. I just finished book one and am not skipping a beat and starting Book two now!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars rest page turner
reviews.reviewText: Loved the characters - each one fascinating in different ways.A sober reminder of the world we live in, it left me feeling a bit, well, hopeless. I will never understand the need for power and what people will do to get it.Great book - on to the 2nd!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Just could not put this down great read would recommend highly.Can’t wait to read the next book just brilliant
Nice spy thriller that keeps u tied in till the end. Has a bit of historical truth to it. Recommended.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fantastic story! Couldn't put it down!
reviews.reviewText: One of the best thriller novels I have read. Highly recommend.

I thoroughly enjoyed this book. You feel that the author knows the former Soviet Union, Moscow, the details of now Russian political investigation techniques and deception. He mixes elementary psychology about women in the forefront.I couldn’t let the book down...and will definitely continue the series. Than you, Author Herzog

reviews.reviewTitle: A high stakes spy war leads to an unforgettable debut thriller
reviews.reviewText: Meet „retired“ CIA asset Lance Spector - a man with an endearing sense of humor and a very particular set of deadly skills. When we first encounter him, he is in a remarkable situation that immediately forges an emotional connection between him and the reader.With such a great introduction, Saul Herzog sets the bar pretty high from the start and doesn’t let go til the very end.The characters are among the most fully realized that I came across in this genre in quite a while. The story is deftly plotted, and Herzog pulls together the many threads of the complex narrative masterfully at the end.The pacing is also very good and the thrill-factor of the many shocking twists is amplified by the pulse-pounding action scenes, which have an alluring cinematic touch to them.THE ASSET is a truly stunning debut and I can’t wait to see how the story continues in THE RUSSIAN!
